def random_colors(number_of_colors):
    color = ["#"+''.join([random.choice('0123456789ABCDEF') for j in range(6)])
                 for i in range(number_of_colors)]
    return color

#Code by AndresHG  https://www.kaggle.com/andreshg/kaggle-survey-a-graph-story

q = {}

navy = "#000080"
red = "#DC143C"
#primary_blue2 = "#85a1c1"

for i in range(1,11):
    q.update(dict(df["US Region"].value_counts()))
q = pd.DataFrame(q.items(), columns = ['US Region', 'counts'])
q = q.sort_values('counts')

q['colour'] = [red for _ in range(len(q['US Region']))]
q.loc[0, 'colour'] = navy
q.loc[1:3, 'colour'] = navy

fig = go.Figure(go.Bar(
    x = q['counts'],
    y = q['US Region'],
    marker_color = q['colour'],
    orientation='h',
))
fig.update_traces(
    marker_line_color = 'black',
    marker_line_width = 1, 
    opacity = 0.9,
)
fig.update_layout(
    title = 'US Regions',
    yaxis={'categoryorder':'total ascending'}
    
)
fig.show()
